transformlib package¶

class transformlib.Input(relative_path: Path | str, reader: Any | None = None, writer: Any | None = None, **metadata: Any)[source]¶

Bases: Node

An Input is a source in a directed asyclic graph of data transformations.

class transformlib.Node(relative_path: Path | str, reader: Any | None = None, writer: Any | None = None, **metadata: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Node base class is a node in a directed asyclic graph of data transformations.

Parameters:

  • relative_path (Path | str) – The path relative to config['data_dir'] where data associated with the node is saved or loaded from.

  • reader (Function) – A function used to read from the node. If None then a default reader is used.

  • writer (Function) – A function used to write to the node. If None then a default writer is used.

  • **metadata (dict[str, Any] | None) – A dictionary with metadata associated with the node.

Type:

writer¶

A function used to write to the node. If None then a default writer is used.

dict[str, Any] | None

property data_dir: Path¶

The root directory where all data is saved and loaded relative to.

property path: Path¶

The path to the node in the directory config['data_dir'].

Bases: Node

An Output is a sink in a directed asyclic graph of data transformations.

class transformlib.Parameter(value: str | int | float | complex | bool | None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A Parameter can be used to parameterize a Node in a directed asyclic graph of data transformations.

Parameters:

value (str | int | float | complex | bool | None) – The current value of the Parameter.

class transformlib.Pipeline(transforms: list[Transform] | dict[str, Transform] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A Pipeline is a topologically ordered list of transformlib.Transform objects.

A transformlib.Pipeline can be run from the command line:

transform path/to/transforms/*.py
transform -v path/to/transforms/*.py

This will topologically sort and run all transformlib.Transform objects found in the .py files.

classmethod from_paths(paths: list[str] | list[Path])[source]¶

Initialize a transformlib.Pipeline from all transformlib.Transform(s) found in a list of path(s) to .py files.

As part of this initialization the parent folder to each path is appended to PYTHONPATH.

class transformlib.Transform(runner: Any, function: Any, args: tuple[Input | Output | Parameter, ...], kwargs: dict[str, Input | Output | Parameter] | dict[str, Input | Parameter])[source]¶

Bases: object

A transformlib.Transform loads, transforms and saves data.

A transformlib.Transform is a lazily evaluated many to many transformation between transformlib.Input and transformlib.Output nodes.

Parameters:

  • runner (Function) – A function specifying how the transformation is being run.

  • function (Function) – A function that contains the data transformation logic used to load and transform the transformlib.Input nodes and save the output to the transformlib.Output nodes.

  • args (tuple[Input | Output | Parameter, ...]) – All arguments to the transformation.

  • kwargs (dict[str, Input | Output | Parameter] | dict[str, Input | Parameter]) – All keyword arguments to the transformation.

Raises:

  • TransformlibDuplicateInputException – If duplicate transformlib.Input exists.

  • TransformlibDuplicateOutputException – If duplicate transformlib.Output exists.

property input_args: tuple[Input, ...]¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Inputarguments.

A dictionary with all the transformlib.Inputkeyword arguments.

property inputs: tuple[Input, ...]¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Input(s) to the transformlib.Transform.

property nodes: tuple[Input | Output, ...]¶

All transformlib.Output(s) and transformlib.Input(s).

property output_args: tuple[Output, ...]¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Outputarguments.

property output_kwargs: dict[str, Output]¶

A dictionary with all the transformlib.Outputkeyword arguments.

property outputs: tuple[Output, ...]¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Output(s) of the transformlib.Transform.

property parameter_args: tuple[Parameter, ...]¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Parameterarguments.

property parameter_kwargs: dict[str, Parameter]¶

A dictionary with all the transformlib.Parameterkeyword arguments.

property parameters: tuple[Parameter, ...]¶

run() → None[source]¶

Loads data from the transformlib.Input(s), transforms it and saves data to the transformlib.Output(s).

transformlib.transform(*args: Input | Output | Parameter, **kwargs: Input | Output | Parameter) → Callable[[Any], Transform][source]¶

Convert a function to a transformlib.Transform.

A Transform is often constructed using the transformlib.transform() decorator:

import json
from transformlib import transform, Output, Input


@transform(
    json_output=Output('mapping.json'),
    txt_input=Input('mapping.txt'),
)
def convert_to_json(json_output, txt_input):
    text = txt_input.path.read_text()
    mapping = dict(map(lambda line: line.split(','), text.splitlines()))
    json_output.path.write_text(json.dumps(mapping, indent=4))

In above example the convert_to_json is a transformlib.Transform object that can be part of a transformlib.Pipeline of many transformations.

Parameters:

**kwargs (dict[str, Node]) – The transformlib.Input and transformlib.Output nodes of the transform.

Returns:

A decorator that returns a Transform object.

Return type:

Callable[[Function], Transform]

transformlib.transform_pandas(*args: Output, **kwargs: Input | Parameter) → Callable[[Any], Transform][source]¶

Convert a pandas function to a transformlib.Transform.

A Transform that operates on pandas DataFrames are often constructed using the transformlib.transform_pandas() decorator:

from transformlib import transform_pandas, Output, Input
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
import pandas as pd
import joblib


@transform_pandas(
    Output("model.joblib", writer=joblib.dump),
    X_train=Input(
        "X_train.csv",
        dtype={
            "HouseAge": "float64",
            "AveRooms": "float64",
            "AveBedrms": "float64",
            "Population": "float64",
            "AveOccup": "float64",
            "Latitude": "float64",
            "Longitude": "float64",
            "MedHouseVal": "float64",
        },
    ),
    y_train=Input(
        "y_train.csv",
        dtype={
            "MedInc": "float64",
        },
    ),
)
def train(X_train: pd.DataFrame, y_train: pd.DataFrame) -> DecisionTreeRegressor:
    """Train a model and save the trained model."""

    # Fitting the model
    model = DecisionTreeRegressor()
    model.fit(X_train, y_train)

    return model

In above example the train is a transformlib.Transform object that can be part of a transformlib.Pipeline of many pandas DataFrame transformations.

For more see the california housing example.

Parameters:

  • *args (Output) – One or more transformlib.Output(s). The return value of the function is a single object or a tuple of objects expected to be written to args and with the same order as args.

  • **kwargs (dict[str, Input | Parameter]) – The transformlib.Input and transformlib.Parameter of the transform.

Returns:

A decorator that returns a Transform object.

Return type:

Callable[[Function], Transform]

Raises:

ModuleNotFoundError – If pandas is not installed.
